original: mtshe ma'am / dga' ldan nam /
analyzed: mtshe ma'am / dga' ldan nam /
translated: Tuṣita,🔽

original: 'phrul dga'am / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phrul dga'am / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar bya'o //
translated: or the Yāma gods, or the Tuṣita gods, or the Nirmāṇarati gods, or the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods.

original: zhe'am / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya'o //
analyzed: zhe'am / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya'o //
translated: I will attain the fruit of entering the stream.

original: zhe'am / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: zhe'am / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: I will attain the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: I will attain the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: I will attain arhatship.

original: rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: rang byang chub bam /
translated: I will attain individual enlightenment.

original: byang chub thob par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub thob par bya'o //
translated: I will attain complete buddhahood.’

original: zhes tshul khrims des snyems pa med do //
analyzed: zhes tshul khrims des snyems pa med do //
translated: “He does not become proud because of that morality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni /
translated: And why?

original: mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are without defining characteristics.🔽They are of one defining characteristic,

original: 'di ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mtshan nyid gcig pas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mtshan nyid gcig pas na /
translated: which is that they have the defining characteristic of the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis mtshan nyid med pa'i chos thob par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis mtshan nyid med pa'i chos thob par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, a phenomenon that is without defining characteristics cannot attain a phenomenon that is without defining characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos kyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos thob par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos kyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos thob par mi rung ngo //
translated: And a phenomenon that has a different defining characteristic cannot attain a phenomenon that has a different defining characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am /🔽mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am / mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis kyang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'am /
translated: A phenomenon that has a different characteristic🔽or a phenomenon that has no characteristic cannot be the basis of a characteristic.🔽

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos thob par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos thob par mi rung ngo //
translated: nor can a phenomenon that has a defining mark obtain a phenomenon that has no defining mark.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: “Subhūti, in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid med pa yongs su rdzogs @491a *//🔽par byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid med pa yongs su rdzogs @491a *// par byas nas /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, having completed the perfection of morality that has no defining mark,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go /
translated: enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa'i tshe mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa'i tshe mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ste /
translated: When they enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva, they obtain the patient acceptance of dharmas that do not arise.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa'i tshe rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa lnga rab tu thob nas gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo lnga brgya la gnas te; so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa'i tshe rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa lnga rab tu thob nas gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo lnga brgya la gnas te; so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: When they practice the knowledge of the aspects of the path, they attain the five higher cognitions that arise from evolution and, having attained the four detailed and thorough knowledges, they serve the lord buddhas, abiding in the five hundred dhāraṇī gateways and the five hundred gateways of meditative stabilization.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
translated: They go from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: They bring beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: They take hold of the buddhafields.

original: de 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na 'khor yang 'khor ba'i las rnam par smin pas gos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na 'khor yang 'khor ba'i las rnam par smin pas gos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though they circle in the five realms of saṃsāra, they are not sullied by the evolutionary actions of saṃsāra.

original: 'di ltar dper na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na /
translated: For example,

original: sprul pa ni /🔽'gro ba'am / sdod pa'am /🔽'dug pa'am / nyal ba byed kyang de la 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: sprul pa ni / 'gro ba'am / sdod pa'am / 'dug pa'am / nyal ba byed kyang de la 'gro ba'am /
translated: an emanation🔽may walk, stand,🔽sit, or lie down, but it does not have any going or coming,

original: 'ong ba'am / sdod pa'am /
analyzed: 'ong ba'am / sdod pa'am /
translated: standing, sitting, or lying down.

original: 'dug pa'am / nyal ba'ang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'dug pa'am / nyal ba'ang mi dmigs te /
translated: nor does he apprehend sitting or lying down.

original: de sems can rnams kyi don kyang byed do //
analyzed: de sems can rnams kyi don kyang byed do //
translated: And he also works for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems can dang sems can du btags pa'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can dang sems can du btags pa'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: And he does not apprehend sentient beings or the designation of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shin tu zhi ba zhes bya ba /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs @491b rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te sems can tshad med pa theg pa gnyis kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shin tu zhi ba zhes bya ba / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs @491b rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te sems can tshad med pa theg pa gnyis kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs
translated: For example, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha, who is called “Very Peaceful,”🔽after fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, turning the wheel of the Dharma, and passing into nirvāṇa through the two vehicles countless sentient beings, did not see any bodhisattva at all who was to be given a prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu gang yang ma gzigs nas des tshe'i 'du byed spangs nas sprul pas sprul par mdzad de /
analyzed: pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu gang yang ma gzigs nas des tshe'i 'du byed spangs nas sprul pas sprul par mdzad de /
translated: Then he abandoned the compositional factors of life and emanated an emanation.

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: and then passed into parinirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the skandhas.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar sprul pa des bskal pa gcig lon nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan te yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar sprul pa des bskal pa gcig lon nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan te yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to //
translated: Subhūti, after that emanation had passed one eon, he predicted the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of the bodhisattva mahāsattva and then passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa de'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa de'i gzugs sam /
translated: No form of his,🔽no feeling,

original: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam /🔽'du byed dam; rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: tshor ba'am / 'du shes sam / 'du byed dam; rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: no perception,🔽no volitional factors,

original: dngos po gang yang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: dngos po gang yang dmigs su med do //
translated: and no consciousness can be apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sems can nam sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang sems can nam sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs la /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, bodhisattva mahāsattvas do not apprehend a being or even the designation of a being,

original: sems can rnams kyi don kyang byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don kyang byed de /
translated: but they do work for the welfare of beings.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they complete the perfection of morality that is without defining characteristics.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pas mtshan nyid med pa'i chos thams cad khongs su chud par @492a *//
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pas mtshan nyid med pa'i chos thams cad khongs su chud par @492a *//
translated: By completing that, they know that all phenomena that are without defining characteristics are included within it.

original: shes so; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: shes so; ;rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas /
translated: further, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they stand in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a dream,

original: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas te /
analyzed: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas te /
translated: and they stand in the five appropriating aggregates that are like an echo, like an optical aberration, like a mirage, like a magical creation, and like a phantom.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They complete the perfection of patience that is without defining characteristics.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams la gnas shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams la gnas shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: Subhuti: How does the Bodhisattva, the great being, coursing in the perfection of patience, perfect the perfection of patience?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa gnyis kyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa gnyis kyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: The Lord: Here the Bodhisattva, the great being, perfects the perfection of patience through two kinds of patience.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: nyams su len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos khong du chud pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos khong du chud pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The patience of accepting suffering and the patience of conviction about dharmas.

original: de la nyams su len pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyams su len pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the patience of accepting suffering?

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du gal te sems can thams cad yang dang yang 'ongs shing gshe ba'am /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du gal te sems can thams cad yang dang yang 'ongs shing gshe ba'am /
translated: From the time when he has first produced the thought of enlightenment up to the time when he sits on the terrace of enlightenment, if all beings should come to the Bodhisattva, the great being, and revile, abuse, and threaten him with evil, and if the Bodhisattva should feel no anger, no resentment, no annoyance, and if he should think: 'How great is the wonder of this world, that here in this world beings are born who are not pleased with the perfection of patience, who are not pleased with the perfection of giving, etc.

original: mi snyan par brjod cing ma klas pa'i tshig brlang po zer bar gyur tam /
analyzed: mi snyan par brjod cing ma klas pa'i tshig brlang po zer bar gyur tam /
translated: or if they speak unpleasantly, insultingly, or harshly to you,

original: rdo dbyug dang / mtshon chas brdegs sam /🔽@492b btab kyang de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pas sems bskyed pa 'ga' tsam yang 'khrugs pa dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: rdo dbyug dang / mtshon chas brdegs sam / @492b btab kyang de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pas sems bskyed pa 'ga' tsam yang 'khrugs pa dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Even if they were to say unpleasant things to me, insult me, or beat me with clubs and swords,🔽the bodhisattva great being who wishes to perfect the perfection of patience should not arouse even one single thought that is disturbed or

original: gnod sems dang ldan pa bskyed par mi bya ste /🔽phyir sems can de dag la kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: gnod sems dang ldan pa bskyed par mi bya ste / phyir sems can de dag la kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: malicious.

original: nyon mongs pa'i nad kyis mnar ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nad kyis mnar ba ste /
translated: “Alas! These sentient beings are afflicted by the disease of the afflictions.

original: 'di dag la bdag gis sdig to'i sems mi skyed kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag la bdag gis sdig to'i sems mi skyed kyi /
translated: I will not arouse a sinful mind toward them.🔽This is the repayment for my taking on these enemies, the aggregates.”

original: 'di ni / bdag nyid kyis phung po'i dgrar gyur pa 'di rnams blangs pa'i lan to zhes de dag la lhag par snying rje bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / bdag nyid kyis phung po'i dgrar gyur pa 'di rnams blangs pa'i lan to zhes de dag la lhag par snying rje bskyed par bya'o //
translated: He should arouse a special compassion for them.

original: byams pa dang ldan te snying rje par gyur nas rnam pa de ltar rtog pa 'di ni /
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan te snying rje par gyur nas rnam pa de ltar rtog pa 'di ni /
translated: Having become loving and compassionate, he should reflect in this way:

original: nyams su len pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyams su len pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the patience of practice.

original: de la chos khong du chud pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos khong du chud pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the patience of understanding phenomena?

original: sems can de dag kyang don dam par dmigs su med na; bdag la gshe ba'am /🔽mi snyan par brjod pa'am /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang don dam par dmigs su med na; bdag la gshe ba'am / mi snyan par brjod pa'am /
translated: If those sentient beings are ultimately unobservable, who is there to scold me,🔽to speak unpleasantly to me,

original: ma klas pa'i tshig brlang po zer ba'am /
analyzed: ma klas pa'i tshig brlang po zer ba'am /
translated: to use abusive language toward me,

original: rdo dbyug gis brdeg cing mtshon 'debs pa lta su zhig yod de /
analyzed: rdo dbyug gis brdeg cing mtshon 'debs pa lta su zhig yod de /
translated: or to beat me with sticks and swords?

original: 'du byed thams cad ni; sgyu ma lta bu gsob /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni; sgyu ma lta bu gsob /
translated: All conditioned things are like an illusion, hollow,

original: gsog / rag las pa /
analyzed: gsog / rag las pa /
translated: empty, and insubstantial.

original: nam mkha' lta bu bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang bral ba ste /
translated: They are like space, devoid of self, sentient beings, living creatures, living organisms, souls, individuals, humankind, and humans.

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: All these thoughts

original: yongs su rtog pa las byung ba yin na /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa las byung ba yin na /
translated: arise from conceptualization.

original: bdag la gshe ba dang / mi snyan par brjod pa dang / ma klas pa'i tshig brlang @493a *//
analyzed: bdag la gshe ba dang / mi snyan par brjod pa dang / ma klas pa'i tshig brlang @493a *//
translated: Who is there to scold me, to speak unpleasantly to me, to use abusive language toward me,🔽or to beat me with sticks and swords?

original: por zer ba dang / rdo dbyug gis brdeg cing mtshon 'debs pa lta su zhig yod de /
analyzed: por zer ba dang / rdo dbyug gis brdeg cing mtshon 'debs pa lta su zhig yod de /
translated: Who would say “Give me” or “Do not give me,” or strike with a stone or club, or cut with a weapon?

original: bdag gis ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: bdag gis ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid nye bar bzung ste /
translated: I, having taken up the emptiness of essential nature and the emptiness of the ultimate,

original: de ltar rnam par brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: should not imagine it in that way.”

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: This is called

original: chos khong du chud pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos khong du chud pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “the acceptance of understanding phenomena.”

original: de de ltar yongs su rtog cing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: de de ltar yongs su rtog cing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: Thus, imagining in that way, he perfects the perfection of patience.

original: de bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa des mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: de bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa des mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob bo //
translated: Through perfecting that perfection of patience, he attains the acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bgyi ba ni /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bgyi ba ni /
translated: what is called ‘the acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena’?

original: gang lags / de la spangs pa ni /
analyzed: gang lags / de la spangs pa ni /
translated: What is abandoned there?

original: ci mchis / ye shes ni /
analyzed: ci mchis / ye shes ni /
translated: What is the wisdom?”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: ci mchis / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ci mchis / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / chos gang la rdul tsam yang skye ba med pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos gang la rdul tsam yang skye ba med pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, any phenomenon that does not arise even to the extent of the most subtle particle

original: mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba'o //
translated: is non-arising.

original: de gang gis shes pa de ni /
analyzed: de gang gis shes pa de ni /
translated: One who knows that

original: bzod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bzod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is said to have patience.

original: shes pa des mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: shes pa des mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob bo //
translated: Through that knowledge, one attains patience with respect to unborn phenomena.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa gang lags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa gang lags pa'i bzod pa de dag la bye brag tu bgyi ba ci mchis /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa gang lags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa gang lags pa'i bzod pa de dag la bye brag tu bgyi ba ci mchis / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Blessed One, what is the difference between the patience with respect to unborn phenomena of the hearers and solitary buddhas and the patience with respect to unborn phenomena of bodhisattva great beings?”

original: rab 'byor / rgyun du zhugs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spang @493b pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rgyun du zhugs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spang @493b pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Subhūti, the knowledge of the stream enterers and the abandonment they have

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
translated: is the patience of bodhisattva great beings.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spangs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spangs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The knowledge of the once-returners and the abandonment they have🔽is the patience of bodhisattva great beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
translated: This is the patience of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spangs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spangs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The knowledge and abandonment of the non-returner

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
translated: is the patience of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: dgra bcom pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spangs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / spangs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The knowledge and abandonment of the arhat

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
translated: is the patience of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa gang yin pa dang / spangs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa gang yin pa dang / spangs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The knowledge and abandonment of the pratyekabuddha

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa ste /
translated: is the patience of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni /
translated: Subhūti,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i bye brag yin no //
translated: this is the difference between the patience of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and the patience of the bodhisattvas.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
translated: Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings

original: bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon te /
translated: Endowed with such patience, they surpass all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa la gnas te /
translated: “Abiding in the patience that comes from the ripening of karma,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la spyod cing lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la spyod cing lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: they practice the bodhisattva path and perfect the knowledge of path aspects.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams dang mi 'bral ba yin /🔽de mngon par shes @494a *//
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams dang mi 'bral ba yin / de mngon par shes @494a *//
translated: “When that is perfected, they are never separate from the thirty-seven aspects of awakening, the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness meditative stabilizations,

original: pa lnga dang mi 'bral ba yin /
analyzed: pa lnga dang mi 'bral ba yin /
translated: and the five superknowledges.🔽“They are never separate from the superknowledges.

original: de mngon par shes pa rnams dang mi 'bral bas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa rnams dang mi 'bral bas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa yin /
translated: “Never separate from the superknowledges, they bring beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa yin /
translated: They purify a buddhafield.

original: de sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas /
analyzed: de sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas /
translated: “Having brought beings to maturity

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed de /
translated: having purified a buddhafield, in a single instant, with wisdom, they will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe mtshan nyid med pa bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe mtshan nyid med pa bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom complete the perfection of patience without attributes.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom are in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a dream,

original: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: He practices diligence of body and mind while standing in the five appropriating aggregates which are like an echo, like an optical aberration, like an illusion, like a mirage, and like a magical creation.

original: de lus kyi brtson 'grus kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: de lus kyi brtson 'grus kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: “He, through the diligence of body, accomplishes the superknowledges.

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu song nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu song nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: Having gone to world systems in all directions and subdirections, he serves the lord buddhas

original: sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: and works for the welfare of beings.

original: sangs rgyas @494b kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas @494b kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: He purifies a buddhafield.

original: de lus kyi brtson 'grus des sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas nas theg pa gsum la 'dzud cing rab tu 'god de /
analyzed: de lus kyi brtson 'grus des sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas nas theg pa gsum la 'dzud cing rab tu 'god de /
translated: Having brought beings to maturity through that diligence of body, he introduces them to and establishes them in the three vehicles.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, that is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of diligence.🔽“Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of concentration is this.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe mtshan nyid med pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe mtshan nyid med pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they complete the perfection of effort that has no marks.

original: de sems kyi brtson 'grus zag pa med pa /
analyzed: de sems kyi brtson 'grus zag pa med pa /
translated: That effort of mind is undefiled,

original: lam gyi yan lag tu gyur pa /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag tu gyur pa /
translated: becomes a branch of the path,

original: lam gyi khongs su chud pas /
analyzed: lam gyi khongs su chud pas /
translated: and is included in the path.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang du dge ba'i chos thams cad 'di lta ste; dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang du dge ba'i chos thams cad 'di lta ste; dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang /
translated: The perfection of effort is where all wholesome dharmas are included, namely, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
translated: the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the three gateways to liberation, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su 'dus pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su 'dus pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: the nine serial absorptions, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de la spyod cing byang @495a *//
analyzed: de la spyod cing byang @495a *//
translated: Practicing those,

original: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings complete the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de yongs su rdzogs par bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs par bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is perfected, all the latent tendencies will be abandoned.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs nas /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned all the latent tendencies,

original: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: he will perfect the excellent marks.

original: kun tu snang ba thob par byas nas chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis rgyud gsum du bskor ba bskor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun tu snang ba thob par byas nas chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis rgyud gsum du bskor ba bskor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having attained universal illumination, he will turn the wheel of Dharma in three turnings and twelve aspects.

original: de bskor bas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yo ba dang / rab tu g-yo ba dang / kun nas g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba dang / rab tu 'gul ba dang / kun nas 'gul ba dang /
analyzed: de bskor bas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yo ba dang / rab tu g-yo ba dang / kun nas g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba dang / rab tu 'gul ba dang / kun nas 'gul ba dang /
translated: When that is turned, the trichiliocosm will shake, quake, and tremble in six ways,

original: ldeg pa dang / rab tu ldeg pa dang / kun nas ldeg par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ldeg pa dang / rab tu ldeg pa dang / kun nas ldeg par 'gyur te /
translated: and it will heave, heave strongly, and heave intensely.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyang snang ba chen pos rgyas par gang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyang snang ba chen pos rgyas par gang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The entire trichiliocosm will be filled with a great light.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i sgra gang du byung zhing dbyangs grags par 'gyur ba'i sgra de stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed kyis thos pa de thams cad theg pa🔽gsum po nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de'i sgra gang du byung zhing dbyangs grags par 'gyur ba'i sgra de stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed kyis thos pa de thams cad theg pa gsum po nges par 'gyur te /
translated: “Subhūti, the sound of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly awakened Buddha’s speech, wherever it occurs and is heard, will cause all the beings in the great billionfold world system to be established in the three vehicles.🔽“Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of perseverance is endowed with such great benefits.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar phan pa chen po dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar phan pa chen po dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Abiding in the perfection of perseverance, bodhisattva great beings will complete all the buddhadharmas.🔽They will attain the knowledge of all aspects.”🔽“Lord, how do bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of giving?”🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of giving by not taking up any dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @495b po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @495b po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of morality?”🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of morality by not taking up any dharma.🔽“Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of patience?”🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of patience by not taking up any dharma.🔽“Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of perseverance?”🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of perseverance by not taking up any dharma.🔽“Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of concentration?”

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of concentration by not taking up any dharma.🔽“Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of wisdom?”🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of wisdom by not taking up any dharma.🔽“Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of skillful means?”🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection of perseverance complete the perfection of skillful means by not taking up any dharma.🔽“Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings training in the perfection

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they stand in the five appropriating aggregates which are like a dream,

original: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: and they stand in the five appropriating aggregates which are like an echo, like an apparition, like a mirage, like a magical creation, and like a phantom, and they complete the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas /
translated: when they practice the perfection of wisdom stand in the five appropriating aggregates which are like a dream,🔽and how do they complete the perfection of meditative stabilization?

original: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sgra brnyan lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: “If you ask, Su­bhūti, how great bodhisattva beings, abiding in the five grasping aggregates that are like a dream, and abiding in the five grasping aggregates that are like a mirage, an optical aberration, a magical display, a phantom, and an apparition, perfect the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: in this regard, Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings attain and maintain the first meditative concentration,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: attain and maintain the second meditative concentration,

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽bsam gtan @496a *//
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // bsam gtan @496a *//
translated: attain and maintain the third meditative concentration,

original: bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //🔽byams pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so // byams pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: attain and maintain the fourth meditative concentration,🔽attain and maintain loving kindness,

original: snying rje la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: snying rje la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: attain and maintain compassion,

original: dga' ba la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: dga' ba la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: attain and maintain empathetic joy,

original: btang snyoms la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: btang snyoms la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: and attain and maintain equanimity.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He abides in the sphere of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He abides in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He abides in the sphere of nothingness.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He abides in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom mo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom mo //
translated: He cultivates the emptiness, signless, and wishless meditative stabilizations.

original: glog lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin sgom mo //
analyzed: glog lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin sgom mo //
translated: He cultivates the lightning-like meditative stabilization.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom mo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom mo //
translated: He cultivates the correct meditative stabilization.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas shing /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas shing /
translated: He abides in the vajra-like meditative stabilization.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par nyan thos dang thun mong ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par nyan thos dang thun mong ba'am /
translated: Except for the thus-gone meditative stabilization, he cultivates all the meditative stabilizations that are shared with the śrāvakas🔽and the solitary buddhas.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang ji snyed pa dang / gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshogs gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad lus kyis khyab par byas shing nye bar bsgrubs te gnas kyang ting nge 'dzin de dag dang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang ji snyed pa dang / gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshogs gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad lus kyis khyab par byas shing nye bar bsgrubs te gnas kyang ting nge 'dzin de dag dang /
translated: They pervade and accomplish all the concentrations and meditative absorptions that are shared with the pratyekabuddhas, and all the other concentrations and meditative absorptions that are shared with the assembly of the hosts of beings.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu'i ro myong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu'i ro myong bar mi byed do //
translated: However, they do not experience the taste of the results of those concentrations and meditative absorptions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ting nge 'dzin de dag gi @496b mtshan nyid med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pas na /🔽mtshan nyid med pa'i ches mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyi ro myong bar byed par yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ting nge 'dzin de dag gi @496b mtshan nyid med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pas na / mtshan nyid med pa'i ches mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyi ro myong bar byed par yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: It is because those bodhisattva great beings know the defining characteristics of those concentrations to be nonexistent and to be the intrinsic identity of non-entities.🔽How could they experience the taste of a nonexistent phenomenon with a nonexistent phenomenon?

original: dngos po med pa'i chos kyang dngos po med pa'i chos kyi ro myong bar byed par yang ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i chos kyang dngos po med pa'i chos kyi ro myong bar byed par yang ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could they experience the taste of a non-entity with a non-entity?

original: de ro myong bar byed pa med pas ting nge 'dzin gang gis dbang gis kyang gzugs kyi khams sam /
analyzed: de ro myong bar byed pa med pas ting nge 'dzin gang gis dbang gis kyang gzugs kyi khams sam /
translated: Since it is not relished, it is not born from the power of any concentration.🔽

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he has no taste for it, he does not take rebirth in the form realm or the formless realm through the power of any meditative absorption.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar des khams de gnyis kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: 'di ltar des khams de gnyis kyang mi dmigs /
translated: Because he does not apprehend those two realms,

original: gang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gang gis snyoms par 'jug pa de'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gang gis snyoms par 'jug pa de'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: nor does he apprehend the one who enters meditative absorption, nor does he apprehend the meditative absorption itself.

original: de mi dmigs pas mtshan nyid med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pas mtshan nyid med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: By not apprehending anything, he perfects the perfection of meditative absorption that has no mark.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa des nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yongs su 'da'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa des nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yongs su 'da'o //
translated: Through that perfection of meditative absorption, he transcends the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti then said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: how is it

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yongs su 'da' ba lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yongs su 'da' ba lags /
translated: “Lord, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of concentration complete the perfection of concentration and go beyond the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de ni /
translated: The Lord said,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nang stong pa nyid la shin tu bslabs pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa @497a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nang stong pa nyid la shin tu bslabs pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa @497a *//
translated: “Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings have trained well in inner emptiness, have trained well in outer emptiness, have trained well in inner and outer emptiness, have trained well in the emptiness of emptiness,

original: nyid la shin tu bslabs pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la shin tu bslabs pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang /
analyzed: nyid la shin tu bslabs pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la shin tu bslabs pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang /
translated: have trained well in great emptiness, have trained well in ultimate emptiness, have trained well in conditioned emptiness, have trained well in unconditioned emptiness,

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la shin tu bslabs pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la shin tu bslabs pa dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la shin tu bslabs pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la shin tu bslabs pa dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang /
translated: It is to be well trained in the emptiness of inherent existence.🔽It is to be well trained in the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽It is to be well trained in the emptiness of its own mark.🔽It is to be well trained in the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang /
translated: It is to be well trained in the emptiness of non-things.🔽It is to be well trained in the emptiness of essence.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la shin tu bslab pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is to be well trained in the emptiness of the essence of non-things.

original: stong pa nyid 'di dag la ni /🔽rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di dag la ni / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: These emptinesses🔽are the result of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /🔽dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am / dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: or🔽the state of a worthy one,🔽or🔽the pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: rang byang chub bam /
translated: or to the pratyekabuddha level,🔽

original: gang la gnas par bya ba'i chos de lta bu gang yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gang la gnas par bya ba'i chos de lta bu gang yang mi dmigs te /
translated: any dharma at all that could be a basis,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba de'ang stong pa nyid rnams kyis stong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba de'ang stong pa nyid rnams kyis stong ste /
translated: that ‘knowledge of all aspects’ is empty of the emptinesses,

original: stong pa nyid de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' @497b sems dpa' chen po nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yongs su shin tu 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' @497b sems dpa' chen po nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yongs su shin tu 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug go /
translated: and by means of those emptinesses, bodhisattva great beings, having completely transcended the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels, enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon ni /
translated: what are the bodhisattva great beings’ faults,

original: gang lags / skyon ma mchis pa ni /
analyzed: gang lags / skyon ma mchis pa ni /
translated: and what is the secure state?”

original: gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / dmigs pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dmigs pa thams cad ni /
translated: all objective supports

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i skyon no //
translated: are the bodhisattva great beings’ faults,

original: mi dmigs pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa thams cad ni /
translated: and all non-objective supports

original: skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: skyon med pa'o //
translated: are the secure state.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni /
translated: what is an object of observation?

original: gang lags / mi dmigs pa ni /🔽gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gang lags / mi dmigs pa ni / gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: What is not an object of observation?”🔽The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs ni /
translated: form

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: is an object of observation for bodhisattva great beings.🔽Subhūti,

analyzed: rab 'byor / tshor ba ni /
translated: feeling

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: is an object of observation for bodhisattva great beings.🔽Subhūti,

analyzed: rab 'byor / 'du shes ni /
translated: perception

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: is an object of observation for bodhisattva great beings.🔽Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / 'du byed ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'du byed ni /
translated: volitional factors

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa'o; ;rab 'byor /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa'o; ;rna ba dang sgra ni /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Eye consciousness

analyzed: dmigs pa'o // mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni /
translated: is the object of observation. Eye contact

analyzed: dmigs pa'o // mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni / dmigs pa'o // rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: is the object of observation. Feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact🔽is the object of observation. Ear consciousness

original: dmigs pa'o // rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa ni /
translated: is the object of observation. Ear contact🔽is the object of observation. Feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact

original: dmigs pa'o // rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni; dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni; dmigs pa'o //
translated: is the object of observation.

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Nose consciousness

original: dmigs pa'o // sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni /
translated: is the object of observation. Nose contact

original: dmigs pa'o // sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
translated: is the object of observation. Feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact🔽is the object of observation.

original: dmigs pa'o // lce'i rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // lce'i rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The object of perception is the tongue consciousness.

original: dmigs pa'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni /
translated: The object of perception is the tongue sense base.

original: dmigs pa'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
translated: The object of perception is the contact that arises from the coming together of the tongue sense base, a taste, and the tongue consciousness.

original: dmigs pa'o // lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni /🔽dmigs pa'o; ;lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni / dmigs pa'o; ;lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni /
translated: The object of perception is the body consciousness.🔽The object of perception is the body sense base.

original: dmigs pa'o // lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
translated: The object of perception is the contact that arises from the coming together of the body sense base, a tangible object, and the body consciousness.

original: dmigs pa'o // yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni / dmigs pa'o // yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni /
translated: The object of perception is the mind consciousness.🔽The object of perception is the mind sense base.

original: dmigs pa'o // yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
translated: The object of perception is the contact that arises from the coming together of the mind sense base, a mental object, and the mind consciousness.

original: dmigs pa'o // sa'i khams ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // sa'i khams ni /
translated: The object of perception is the earth element.

original: dmigs pa'o // chu'i khams ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // chu'i khams ni /
translated: The object of perception is the water element.

original: dmigs pa'o // me'i @498b khams ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // rlung gi khams ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // me'i @498b khams ni / dmigs pa'o // rlung gi khams ni /
translated: The object of perception is the fire element.🔽The object of perception is the wind element.

original: dmigs pa'o // nam mkha'i khams ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // nam mkha'i khams ni /
translated: The object of perception is the space element.

original: dmigs pa'o // rnam par shes pa'i khams ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // rnam par shes pa'i khams ni /
translated: The object of perception is the consciousness element.

original: dmigs pa'o // ma rig pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // ma rig pa ni /
translated: The object of perception is ignorance.

original: dmigs pa'o; ;'du byed ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o; ;'du byed ni /
translated: The object of perception is formation.

original: dmigs pa'o // rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Consciousness is an objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // ming dang gzugs ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // ming dang gzugs ni /
translated: Name and form are objective supports.

original: dmigs pa'o // skye mched drug ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // skye mched drug ni /
translated: The six sense spheres are objective supports.

original: dmigs pa'o // reg pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // reg pa ni /
translated: Contact is an objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // tshor ba ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // sred pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // tshor ba ni / dmigs pa'o // sred pa ni /
translated: Sensation is an objective support.🔽Craving is an objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // len pa ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // srid pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // len pa ni / dmigs pa'o // srid pa ni /
translated: Clinging is an objective support.🔽Becoming is an objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // skye ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // skye ba ni /
translated: Birth is an objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // rga shi ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // rga shi ni /
translated: Aging and death are objective supports.

original: dmigs pa'o // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of generosity is an objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni; dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni / dmigs pa'o // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni / dmigs pa'o // brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni; dmigs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of moral discipline is an objective support.🔽The perfection of patience is an objective support.🔽The perfection of perseverance is an objective support.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of concentration is an objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // nang stong pa nyid ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // phyi stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni / dmigs pa'o // nang stong pa nyid ni / dmigs pa'o // phyi stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is an objective support.🔽Inner emptiness is an objective support.🔽Outer emptiness is an objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // phyi nang stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // phyi nang stong pa nyid ni /
translated: Inner and outer emptiness is an objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // chen po stong pa nyid ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // don dam pa stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // chen po stong pa nyid ni / dmigs pa'o // don dam pa stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The emptiness of the great is the objective support.🔽The emptiness of the ultimate is the objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // 'dus byas stong pa nyid ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // 'dus byas stong pa nyid ni / dmigs pa'o // 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The emptiness of the conditioned is the objective support.🔽The emptiness of the unconditioned is the objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // thog ma dang tha ma med @499a *//🔽pa stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ni / dmigs pa'o // thog ma dang tha ma med @499a *// pa stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The emptiness of what transcends limits is the objective support.🔽The emptiness of what has no beginning or end is the objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The emptiness of nonrejection is the objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The emptiness of inherent existence is the objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // chos thams cad stong pa nyid ni; dmigs pa'o //🔽rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // chos thams cad stong pa nyid ni; dmigs pa'o // rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is the objective support.🔽The emptiness of its own mark is the objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ni / dmigs pa'o // dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The emptiness of nonapprehension is the objective support.🔽The emptiness of nonthings is the objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The emptiness of essential nature is the objective support.

original: dmigs pa'o // dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The object of the perfection of wisdom is the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: dmigs pa'o // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni /
translated: The object of the perfection of wisdom is the four applications of mindfulness.

original: dmigs pa'o // yang dag par spong ba rnams ni; dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // yang dag par spong ba rnams ni; dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the perfection of wisdom is the four right efforts.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni /🔽dmigs pa'o // dbang po rnams ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni / dmigs pa'o // dbang po rnams ni /
translated: The object of the perfection of wisdom is the four legs of miraculous power.🔽The object of the perfection of wisdom is the five faculties.

original: dmigs pa'o // stobs rnams ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // stobs rnams ni /
translated: The object of the perfection of wisdom is the five powers.

original: dmigs pa'o // byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni /
translated: The object of the perfection of wisdom is the seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: dmigs pa'o // 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'o // 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni /
translated: The object of the perfection of wisdom is the noble eightfold path.
